channel.title: Help
channel.description:
well i got this code :
[code]JTable T = new JTable(new Object[][] {{"test"}, {"test"}}, new Object[] {"teest", "test"});[/code]
ofcorse theres more.. JFrame ect >.>
anyways it gives me this exception :
[code]Exception in thread "AWT-EventQueue-0" java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1 at javax.swing.JTable$1.getValueAt(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.JTable.getValueAt(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.JTable.prepareRenderer(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.plaf.basic.BasicTableUI.paintCell(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.plaf.basic.BasicTableUI.paintCells(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.plaf.basic.BasicTableUI.paint(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.plaf.ComponentUI.update(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.JComponent.paintComponent(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.JComponent.paint(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.JComponent.paintChildren(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.JComponent.paint(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.JComponent.paintChildren(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.JComponent.paint(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.JLayeredPane.paint(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.JComponent.paintChildren(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.JComponent.paintToOffscreen(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.BufferStrategyPaintManager.paint(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.RepaintManager.paint(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.JComponent.paint(Unknown Source) at java.awt.GraphicsCallback$PaintCallback.run(Unknown Source) at sun.awt.SunGraphicsCallback.runOneComponent(Unknown Source) at sun.awt.SunGraphicsCallback.runComponents(Unknown Source) at java.awt.Container.paint(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.RepaintManager.paintDirtyRegions(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.RepaintManager.paintDirtyRegions(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.RepaintManager.seqPaintDirtyRegions(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.SystemEventQueueUtilities$ComponentWorkRequest.run(Unknown Source) at java.awt.event.InvocationEvent.dispatch(Unknown Source) at java.awt.EventQueue.dispatchEvent(Unknown Source) at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpOneEventForFilters(Unknown Source) at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEventsForFilter(Unknown Source) at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEventsForHierarchy(Unknown Source) at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEvents(Unknown Source) at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEvents(Unknown Source) at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.run(Unknown Source) [/code]
wich i find wierd because it doesent even give a line number :s
and wen the code is this :
[code]JTable T = new JTable(new Object[][] {{"test"}, {"test"}}, new Object[] {"test"});[/code]
it doesent give me it..
sence it doesent give me a line i dont even know if thats were the error is happening or in :
[code]T.setBounds(110, 33, 300, 300);[/code]
or in
[code]P.add(T);[/code]
i was following the swing tutorial on JTables btw >.> [url=http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/uiswing/components/table.html]Sorry if i cant give this link[/url]

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

^^ As adam said, it’s all in the table model. Either make your own, or use an existing one.

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

[quote=“nueb35, post:6, topic:138407”][quote author=Iamadam link=topic=190318.msg1715307#msg1715307 date=1188477364]
Couldn’t be bothered to figure out the problem, but if you intend on doing anything half decent with tables, make your own TableModel.
[/quote]

what do u mena exacly?[/quote]

public class MyTableModel extends AbstractTableModel { ... }
Then you can make your own constructors.

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

ownage thx taharok i would of never thought of that :S

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Oh, lols. You made two columns and entered data into only one of them. You need to at least create an empty array in the multi-dimensional data array for the second column to form and not throw an Exception.

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

Couldn’t be bothered to figure out the problem, but if you intend on doing anything half decent with tables, make your own TableModel.

what do u mena exacly?

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

oh yeah, i misunderstood that. Then something else is throwing your error, i would help you, but i don’t have time right now. School calls

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

Then the Table is constructed using these data and columnNames: 
JTable table = new JTable(data, columnNames);

There are two JTable constructors that directly accept data (SimpleTableDemo uses the first):

* JTable(Object[][] rowData, Object[] columnNames)
* JTable(Vector rowData, Vector columnNames)</blockquote>

?? that was quoted form sun and it says the second isnt 2 dimensional

and also im sure eclipse would of told me if the second had to be 2 dimensional… with a red line?

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

epic fale.

JTable T = new JTable(new Object[][] {{"test"}, {"test"}}, new Object[][] {"teest", "test"});

The second object array wasn’t 2-dimensional.

Read full topic
